intro: Adelobotrys, commonly known as the starry nightshade, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or white. Adelobotrys species often have smooth, glossy leaves and produce small, fleshy berries that contain toxic compounds. Due to their ornamental value and medicinal properties, some species are cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
